data.event: The town was first settled around 1755 within Albany County.

event.title: was established from part of the Town of Coxsackie in 1790

data.event: The town was established from part of the Town of Coxsackie in 1790 as the "Town of Freehold."
In the spring of 1800 Freehold became part of the newly formed Greene County.
Part of the town was lost to form, in 1803, the new Towns of Cairo, Greenville, and Windham.

event.title: 1836, the western part of Durham became

data.event: In 1836, the western part of Durham became the Town of Conesville in Schoharie County.
